channel.title: Load Balancing Third-Party Servers on DEV -- docs-nginx-com
channel.description: Recent content in Load Balancing Third-Party Servers on DEV -- docs-nginx-com

item.title: Load Balancing Apache Tomcat Servers with NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus
item.description:
This deployment guide explains how to use NGINX Open Source and F5 NGINX Plus to load balance HTTP and HTTPS traffic across a pool of Apache TomcatTM application servers. The detailed instructions in this guide apply to both cloud‑based and on‑premises deployments of Tomcat.

About NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus

NGINX Open Source is an open source web server and reverse proxy that is known for its scalability, outstanding performance, and small footprint. NGINX Open Source was first created to solve the C10K problem (serving 10,000 simultaneous connections on a single web server). NGINX Open Source’s features and high-speed performance has made it a staple, NGINX is used by 33.8% of all the websites whose server we know – it’s the #1 web server at the 100,000 busiest websites in the world.

item.title: Load Balancing Microsoft Exchange Servers with NGINX Plus
item.description: This deployment guide explains how to use F5 NGINX Plus to load balance traffic across a pool of Microsoft ExchangeTM servers. You can deploy Exchange and NGINX Plus on premises, in a private cloud, or in public clouds including Amazon Web Services (AWS), the Google Cloud Platform, and Microsoft Azure. The guide covers the different installation types, and provides complete instructions for customizing both NGINX Plus and Exchange as required.

item.title: Load Balancing Node.js Application Servers with NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus
item.description:
This deployment guide explains how to use NGINX Open Source and F5 NGINX Plus to load balance HTTP and HTTPS traffic across a pool of Node.js application servers. The detailed instructions in this guide apply to both cloud‑based and on‑premises deployments of Node.js.

About NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus

NGINX Open Source is an open source web server and reverse proxy that has grown in popularity in recent years because of its scalability, outstanding performance, and small footprint. NGINX Open Source was first created to solve the C10K problem (serving 10,000 simultaneous connections on a single web server). NGINX Open Source’s features and performance have made it a staple of high‑performance sites – it’s the #1 web server at the 100,000 busiest websites in the world.

item.title: Load Balancing Oracle E-Business Suite with NGINX Plus
item.description:
This deployment guide explains how to use F5 NGINX Plus to load balance traffic across a pool of Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) 12 servers. It provides complete instructions for configuring NGINX Plus as required.

About NGINX Plus and Oracle EBS

NGINX Plus is the commercially supported version of NGINX Open Source. NGINX Plus is a complete application delivery platform, extending the power of NGINX with a host of enterprise‑ready capabilities that enhance an Oracle EBS deployment and are instrumental to building web applications at scale:

item.title: Load Balancing Oracle WebLogic Server with NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus
item.description:
This deployment guide explains how to use NGINX Open Source and F5 NGINX Plus to load balance HTTP and HTTPS traffic across a pool of Oracle WebLogic Server application servers. The detailed instructions in this guide apply to both cloud‑based and on‑premises deployments of Oracle WebLogic Server.

About NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus

NGINX Open Source is an open source web server and reverse proxy that has grown in popularity in recent years because of its scalability, outstanding performance, and small footprint. NGINX Open Source was first created to solve the C10K problem (serving 10,000 simultaneous connections on a single web server). NGINX Open Source’s features and performance have made it a staple of high‑performance sites – it’s the #1 web server at the 100,000 busiest websites in the world.

item.title: Load Balancing Wildfly and JBoss Application Servers with NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus
item.description:
This deployment guide explains how to use NGINX Open Source and F5 NGINX Plus to load balance HTTP and HTTPS traffic across a pool of Wildfly (JBoss) application servers. It provides complete instructions for configuring NGINX Open Source or NGINX Plus as required.

About NGINX Open Source and NGINX Plus

NGINX Open Source is an open source web server and reverse proxy that has grown in popularity in recent years because of its scalability, outstanding performance, and small footprint. NGINX Open Source was first created to solve the C10K problem (serving 10,000 simultaneous connections on a single web server). NGINX Open Source’s features and performance have made it a staple of high‑performance sites – it’s the #1 web server at the 100,000 busiest websites in the world.
